did.head: Collection Summary
did.unittitle: Vassar College Women's Studies Program Records

repository.label: Repository:
repository.corpname: Archives and Special Collections Library, Vassar College Libraries

did.abstract: Materials documenting the history of the Vassar College Women's Studies Program from its founding in 1977 to 2007.

bioghist.head: Administrative History
bioghist.p: Since at least 1971 faculty, students, and trustees had advocated the creation of a Women's Studies Program. Not until 1977, however, was the first interdepartmental Women's Studies course added to the College curriculum. The following year a major in Women's Studies was introduced under the auspices of the Independent Program, a major that drew upon courses from a variety of departments. Women's Studies became a separate multidisciplinary concentration in 1986. From 1988 to 1998 the program continued to add new multidisciplinary courses to its curriculum. In 2002-2003 the program began offering a 12-credit multidisciplnary major and a 6-credit correlate sequence.
See Ronald D. Patkus and Elizabeth A. Daniels, eds., An Administrative History of Vassar College, 1861-2003, Poughkeepsie: Vassar College, 2004, p. 62.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: Materials documenting the history of the Vassar College Women's Studies Program from its founding in 1977 to 2007. Includes memos, budgets, correspondence, notes, newsletters, grant proposals, course materials, and publicity materials.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: Some materials in Series I are restricted due to personnel privacy issues. Please consult the archivist for further information. The remainder of the collection is open for research according to the regulations of the Vassar College Archives and Special Collections Library without any additional restrictions.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use
userestrict.p: Permission to quote (publish) from unpublished or previously published material must be obtained as described in the regulations of the Vassar College Archives and Special Collections Library.

controlaccess.head: VCL Categories
controlaccess.subject: Vassar College Academic Departments and Programs

odd.head: Encoding Information
odd.p: Encoded by Mark Seidl, October 2011. Updated by Emma Gronbeck, January 2023.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Collection processed by Laura Streett and Mark Seidl, September-October 2011.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Collection transfered from the Women's Studies Program office, 2008.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Vassar College Women's Studies Program Records, Archives and Special Collections Library, Vassar College Libraries.

did.unittitle: Series I. ADMINISTRATIVE FILES AND CORRESPONDENCE

scopecontent.p: Annual reports, correspondence, Steering Committee files, mailing lists, and other materials relating to the administration of the program. Arranged alphabetically.

Course lists, syllabi, student handbook information, and other materials relating to the program curriculum. Arranged alphabetically with general curriculum files preceding those for individual courses.
Film screening announcements, conference announcements, agendas for "First Friday" gatherings and other materials relating to program events. Arranged alphabetically.
Announcements, publicity materials, schedules, and other materials relating to visiting speakers. Arranged alphabetically with general files preceding those for individual speakers.
Applications, correspondence, questionnaires, and other materials relating to grants for which the program applied and studies in which it participated. Arranged alphabetically.

did.unittitle: Series VI. ORGANIZATIONS AND OTHER WOMEN'S STUDIES PROGRAMS

scopecontent.p: Informational materials, directories, and correspondence relating to women's organizations and Women's Studies programs at other academic institutions. Arranged alphabetically.
Materials concerning athletics, coeducation, sexual harrassment, and other subjects. Arranged alphabetically.
